name: impeachable
content:
Add to word list
Add to word list
deserving or causing impeachment (= a formal statement that a public official might be guilty of a serious offence in connection with his or her job, especially in the US): an impeachable offence Is there evidence of impeachable conduct by the president? See
impeach
More examplesFewer examplesThere is still no proof that the judge has done anything impeachable. The investigation involves an alleged pattern of impeachable behaviour. The president's offences so far are not impeachable.
